other_tests.findings: Normal sinus rhythm, left ventricular hypertrophy, right bundle-branch block, ST-segment depression in leads I, V4, V5, and V6, T-wave inversion in leads I, aVL, and V4 to V6.
Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy with asymmetric septal hypertrophy, normal systolic function, mild mitral regurgitation, and no dynamic outflow obstruction.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The study was repeated two days later with a peak outflow tract gradient of 12 mm Hg at rest and 15 mm Hg with Valsalva maneuver, indicating no provocable gradient.
